title: If P and Q together can complete a work in 18 days, P and R together in 12 days, and Q and R together in 9 days, then Q alone can do the work in? - Quora

response.answer_text: P and Q do (1/18)th of the work in 1 day. P and R do (1/12)th of the work in 1 day. Q and R do (1/9)th of the work in 1 day. 2P+2Q+2R do (1/18)+(1/12)+(1/9) = (6+9+12)/108 = 27/108 = (1/4)th, or P, Q and R do (1/8)th of the work in 1 day. So Q alone can do (1/8)-(1/12) = (3–2)/24 = 1/24th of the work in 1 day. Q, alone, will do the work in 24 days. Answer.

Let the work be considered to have 36- units.In 1- day P+Q can do=36/18= 2- unitsIn 1- day P+R can do= 36/12=3- unitsIn 1- day R+S can do= 36/9= 4- unitsSo P+ Q+ R can do in 1- day= (2+3+4)/2 = 4.5- unitsSo in 1- day Q- alone can = (4.5- 3) =1.5-units.Therefore Q can complete the work alone in = 36/1.5= 24- days.
